Benefits of Drupal Over the Website Builder Systems

Website builder systems used to be one of the most preferred web development techniques, especially for those who had no knowledge of coding. They were widely used to build basic business websites. However with the advent of content management systems, website builders have almost become an obsolete technique. Drupal website development has been one of the leaders in this CMS revolution. Its user-friendliness and robust features make it one of the most preferred web development tools in the world. Let us now take a look at some of the benefits that Drupal offers over website builder system.

Cost of Development – Drupal is an open source CMS which means that you don’t need to incur any expense in designing and developing a website using Drupal. This makes it the first choice for any business website especially the startups. On the other hand for website builders, you need to purchase licensed software such as Dreamweaver that may not be economically viable. Online builder tools from domain and hosting service providers are expensive, that force you pay for the services you may not even use as a part of their website developer packages.

Design and Functionality – If you are choosing a website developer you will need to compromise on the design and functionality of the website. Most site builder come packed with a handful templates, which you would have stick to build a website. This results in mundane websites that don’t attract many eyeballs. Apart from these, the auto-site builders allow you develop only basic websites with basic functionality. Drupal website development however doesn’t tie you to any template or theme as you can design your own from scratch. Apart from this, you can add robust functionality to the website with the use of third-party plugins.

Scalability – Your website needs to constantly keep pace with the changing demands of your business or the quantum leap that web technology may be undergoing. Since website builders have limited options in site customization you will have to stick to the site you have or completely overhaul even when you might need a simple upgrade. Drupal is highly modular in nature that allows you to add features and functionality to the website along with altering the look. When third-party plugins are installed, they immediately offer interactive functions that can be customized to suit your needs.

Search Engine Friendliness – Search engines play a very vital role in driving traffic to your website. But the results depend on the quality and size of your code base. This is where Drupal is miles ahead of website builders as it generates clean and search engine friendly code that helps you rank high in the results pages. Coding is the biggest con of website builder systems as they generate lots of unnecessary lines of coding making the website heavy and load slow on the web browser.

All the above mentioned factors are extremely important for the success of your website and this is why you should choose Drupal website development over website builder system.

Magento Web Development: Get the Best Start in Online Busine

In today’s world, ecommerce accounts for sizable sales and revenue for any business ranging from the ones manufacturing electronic items to those offering some kind of services to the customers. This increased popularity has also increased the competition between the online stores. Thus you need to start your store using robust ecommerce solution and Magento is the clear winner. It is fully packaged ecommerce solution that takes care of all aspects of Magento web development and has revolutionized the way ecommerce websites are designed and developed. This has made it the preferred choice for small and large online stores.

Advantages of Magento for Startup Online Stores

* Cost Advantage – Magento is an open source content management system that will help you cut down on the development costs of your store. You will also have access to hundreds of themes and plugins to build your store. You only need to pay for the services of the web development firm you hire for the job.

* Custom Design – You need to announce yourself to the world when you make the first step into the ecommerce business. This is possible when you opt for custom development of the website where the site is designed from scratch using PSD to Magento and themed around your idea and business goal. This distinctive appearance can be a greatest selling point for your online store.

* User-friendly – You don’t need to know rocket science to manage a Magento powered store as it can easily be managed using a web based interface from anywhere in the world. You can update the home page, product categories, offer discounts and other freebies to your customers without having to touch the codes. You can also create promotional campaign within the store and across the social media with ease.

* Scalability – Change is the only constant in business and you need to regularly update the store with new range of products and services and make the store more interactive for your customers. This is possible when you opt for Magento website development as this CMS is highly modular and allows you to scale up the functionality and features of the store with the help of third-party plugins.

* Online Visibility – An ecommerce store would fail to attract customers if it isn’t search engine friendly, but with Magento in place you don’t have to worry on that front. It generates search engine friendly codes which are easily indexed by the search engine spiders. You can also optimize each and every product listing in your website such in terms of title, description and keywords to attract more traffic.

* Large Market Penetration – For any ecommerce website, it is very important that you reach out to a large market. Magento aids you in this as it allows you to create a multi-lingual online store which appeals to people from different parts of the world. It also offers features such as live currency converter which allows more customers to purchase from your store and transact in their native currency.

Web Promotion Ideas for Website Optimization

Website optimization or what is popularly known as search engine optimization plays a pivotal role in the success of any website. It is an established set of techniques that attracts targeted traffic to the website and make it more popular among users. A good business web design must implement these techniques to be successful. In e-Commerce websites, more traffic can lead to larger number of sales, where as in other corporate or organizational websites it allows marketers to promote their website across a larger target audience. Here are some of the basic web promotion ideas for website optimization which should be a part of your business web design.

Clean Coding – This is one of the basic things that you need to have for an effective optimization campaign. The website should be coded manually and not using WYSIWYG editors which often make the code base large and sloppy. Clean codes attract search engine crawlers and such websites rank high on the search engine results pages. You can opt for semantic coding technique where the site is well-defined resulting in better SEO score. The code needs to undergo W3C validation to ensure that the pages are error free.

Page Title and Description – The page title and description say a lot about the content of your page both to the visitors as well as the search engines and thus you need to be very creative with these. You need to ensure that it defines the page well and contains the primary keywords for your page. The description should be crisp as this will emphasize the content of that page. Page titles and description appear in the search engine results and thus need to catch the eyes of the visitors instantly.

Alt Tag – Images are a part and parcel of any business web design and it is very important that the images are properly defined to the search engines as these results in higher traffic. You can make use of alternate attribute better known as ALT Tag. It is nothing, but an alternative text that is rendered when the element to which it is applied cannot be rendered. The Alt Tag is easily indexed by the search engines that helps attract traffic.

URL Optimization – The URL of your webpage can have a great contributing factor to the overall promotion of the website. It is advisable that you create the URL of the webpages manually by including relevant keywords as this attracts search engines. The URL also has to be short and shouldn’t have more than two sub-indexes. A user should be able to reach any page in the website with least number of clicks.

Create A Sitemap – Creating a sitemap helps letting search engines such as Google and Yahoo know of every single page within your site which helps them crawl the pages with ease. You need to create a sitemap and keep on updating it as and when new sections (not pages) are being added to the website.

Magento and osCommerce: The Late-mover Advantage

There was a time when touch and feel was a must-do for customers before buying anything. That time is now gone, and today's world is witnessing a flourishing ecommerce industry. Thanks to Magento, osCommerce and other ecommerce platforms that helped merchants break new grounds in the ecomm world. But if we get deep into this world and have to decide between Magento and osCommerce, the situation becomes difficult. If we look at the popularity of both, however, Magento is way too ahead of osCommerce.

Magento (2008) came as a new player in the game that osCommerce was playing since 2000. But it soon became the top seed in the market. How? What are the major advantages and disadvantages of Magento – and of osCommerce, for that matter ?

Magento Community: A bigger one, a thriving one than that of osCommerce
There's no denying to the fact that Magento has a huge, thriving community. Magento Forum and Magento Answer are excellent places to find answers to all your issues. Magento Bug Tracking is another great way to depict and resolve a problem in your site. The community of osCommerce, though not as large as Magento's, has numerous relevant discussions going on at everyday basis and has also proved to be handy in solving the problems of users.

Magento provides you with a sea of features – But wait, is there any catch here?
Here you can not only find the major products of Magento but also easily compare them (on the basis of pricing and features). You'll observe that not all of them are free. Only Magento Community, which comparatively has very less features, lacks functionality and is recommended for developers only, comes free. The others (Magento Enterprise and Magento Enterprise Premium) cost you a good amount of money for that sea of features – like strong data encryption, targeted offerings, gifting options, reward points system, enhanced CMS etc. South Korean giant Samsung uses the enterprise version Magento.

There is another version of Magento, not free but relatively cheaper and specially designed for small businesses with big dreams. It's name is Magento Go – you must explore it, for you never know it might be the one for your business.

osCommerce is absolutely free!
On the other hand, osCommerce is completely a free software and you can see all its features here. Some of its major features are: SSL-based transactions, multi-lingual and multi-currency support, unlimited products, fast search, numerous online and offline payment gateways etc. It has always been a user-friendly platform, and its new version is coming soon in the market. However, it doesn't yet offer multiple store feature, which is also available in Magento Community. It similarly lacks features like cross-selling, image zoom-in, checking recently viewed products etc.

We hope we have given you a good overview of Magento and osCommerce. If you have any queries, you can ask us through your comments.

A how-to guide for effective mobile app marketing

Years have passed by since Apple started a story: Story for app mobile developers to do something unprecedented, something out of this world. Google and Apple both today have more than 600K apps in their application stores. And today, mobile app development is happening everywhere across the world. The big thing now is not app development, but app marketing – that too amid a dog-eat-dog competition where every other app is scratching everything under the sun to get talked about. And this post is a bid to help app developers successfully market their apps. This might sound a cliche and some of the what's-about-to-come things might sound generic, but if you religiously make them your guiding light, you'll truly understand their importance.

Let's start from the manufacturing phase: Create one-of-its-kind app
Google says your content should be unique to get a good position in search results. Same applies to apps. If you're just trying to make an improvement – or a copy – of some already-popular app, who's going to notice it unless it's some awesome rethinking/redesigning? But imagine if it is a new concept, it'll become a new bait in itself and will save you thousands of dollars for marketing.

Pouncing onto the last stages of app development
No, here we are not going to steer you into technical hustle bustle. We'll just ask you some questions:

* Taking care of all the market trademarks and knowing that today's world is more likely to fall for an unique, cool yet relevant app, have you decided the name of your app?

* Have you chosen the most relevant category for your app?

* The app that is the result of your creativity and hard work also demands a compelling icon – do you have any?

* Have you started targeting social media for your app? If not, start doing it now. The more buzz you'll be able to create, the more popular your app will end up being.

* Hype, yes hype, is one of the best ways to promote anything, but only if that thing is truly unique. Have you made a hype of your app?

Now that you're ready with your app – what after it?
Immediately after your app is tested and ready to set its feat into the market, start preparing for its grand launch. Send the newsletters. Target the social media again. Host some contests. Give away some attractive gifts. Share the promo codes. Make your presence felt on the popular app sites/blogs. Prepare a making-of-the-app video. And promote it over the Web.

To sum up, your objective of app marketing should be to create an awareness and spread the word about your app – both before and after its release. Make bloggers blogging about your app, tweeple tweeting about it and tech gurus debating about it. The more successful you become in doing all this, the more popular your app is likely to get.

Embrace change or become a Design-O-Saur -- Design tips for

Creating a functional mobile app is simple with some tools and programming skills, but only functional mobile app is not enough at this point when around 1300K other apps (only counting the apps of app store and Google Play) are already available out there. So to make your app stand out in a crowd, it must be featured not only functional.

Here in this post, we’ll provide some design tips through which you can get to know the secret of successful mobile applications.

Design Responsively
Handhold devices are available in the market with various screen sizes, and making an app look great across hundreds of devices with different combinations of screen size, pixel density is what makes it acceptable. So choosing a particular size is really a difficult task, but couple of factors are there on the basis of which you can finalize the one:

* Targeted audience
* Purpose of application

If you are not sure about the size of the screen your audience might prefer, better design something universal, as strategies are available there for coping with the diversity of the platform such as using fluid layouts that can stretch and compress as per the resolution of the screen.

Design For People
The prime factor which must be kept under consideration while creating an mobile app is neither the idea nor the platform, it's the audience for whom you are designing the application. Consider the variety of audience that is going to use that application as defining the targeted audience is half the battle won.

Create your app after imagining the daily routine of your audience – is this app really gonna help them in their day-to-day life? How audience can relate their daily life with your product? Once you start thinking like this, you may come to know the important features missed by your product as defining the audience on terms of their lifestyle is more relevant than defining them on terms of technology.

Design Structurally
The goal is to make the navigation simple and easy for the users. Large number of options can make your users frustrated. So to prevent users from frustration, design an app with user-friendly interface. Keep options in general categories so that user can experience a easy, simple and better navigation menu.

Design Dynamic Content
Dynamic content is the visuals you would show to users when they’re stuck due to lost Internet connection and slow downloading speed. Dealing with such kind of challenges with animations is a great way, as they can keep users distracted when they are supposed to wait and can keep them away from frustration.

Design With Minimum Work
Too much functionality in your mobile app can make its structure very deep, so it's better to display only the content and controls that are necessary for the user at that time as more functional display can confusing for the users. Better to include only core functionality in your mobile application so that essential functions can be used more easily.

Summing Up
Designing a mobile application includes so many big and small factors. Above mentioned design tips are those that are must to keep in mind while designing a mobile application. Screen orientation and font used also need proper designer attention as they are must for an application to perform properly in both landscape & portrait mode and switch between them.

Create More Successful Websites – Witty Ways

Website designing require the efforts of a skilled developer – one who can transform complexity into simplicity. Only a well-designed website is not what you want (or should want) to compete with millions of websites present out there in the world of Internet. So what is that X-factor? What can make your website different from those of your competitors?

Obviously, everyone strives to make their website memorable and design it in such a way that it lasts an unforgettable expression on the visitor's mind. But it's not about thinking big, but about how!

Let's find out that how!

There's no limit to fun and creativity – but only when they're led by your objective!
Fun-filled, creative website design can help us in producing a more engaging website as generating smiles on the faces is the best way to establish a connection; a little humor can break the ice and urges people to take a step ahead.

Here we are not advising you to make a circus site as there is a fine line between sensible design and silly design. And to make your website sound professional, its design must convey your business objective as well. Make it a delightful experience so that remember your message not only gets conveyed but stays with them (your targeted audience).

Things that you can't afford to overlook!
Some pivotal factors that must be kept into consideration while designing an interactive web page are: What to add, where to add and how much to add?

Right amount of interaction at the right places can create a memorable experience, but too much of it can backfire as well, driving your site visitors away.

Proper balance
The most successful websites are those which have the balance of both: what you want to convey and what people are looking for. If visitors don't find the elements they are looking, they will definitely play a major role in taking your website's bounce rate northwards. For ensuring the proper balance, never stop doing your market research and always keep a tab on changes in the buying behavior of people.

Infographics
It is a general approach of thinking that some websites can't be highly interactive as they provide other kind of services. The answer is yes. But that doesn't mean they can't be interactive at all. And in the age of infographics, what other best way you have? Infographics are graciously adopted by many popular brands nowadays and you should too incorporate them in your website to better the way you engage with your visitors.

Summing up
Finally, your aim should be to design a memorable website to leave an impression on people, not to lose them forever either with no interaction or too much of it. Also, keep an eye on your target audience so that your website not only looks attractive but also ensures more and more conversions.

Why Responsive Web Design Is a Must in Today's World?

If you keep track of the web design world you might have noticed responsive web design is one of the most active subjects of discussion. If you aren’t sure what this translates to let us explain this to you in brief. Responsive web design is a technique whereby websites are designed to react to the user’s environment or device. In simple terms, this means a user gets to browse through a comprehensively built website irrespective of the devices he or she uses to access the website.

Responsive websites have a fluid grid structure which in combination with media queries in your CSS, where the breakpoints are predefined, allows the creation of device sensitive layouts. Let us now take a look into the factors which have made responsive web design so important in today’s world.

It’s a Multi Device World

Gone are those days when desktop and laptops were solely used to browse through the Internet. These days smartphones and tablets are being used just as much to access your website, if not more. Responsive web design allows you to cater to all these customers at one gone without having to design and develop customized websites for different platforms. Even within these devices the screen size and resolution keeps changing and it is only with responsive web design that you can create a robust website which is compatible with all these devices.

Clients Are on the Go

Your clients are constantly on the move and it is during this time that they might browse through your website on their smartphones or tablets sipping a cup of coffee or taking a ride in the underground tube. Imagine the competitive advantage that your website would have over the rivals if you can offer a full scale site to these clients against a skimmed one, which most traditional mobile websites were. This can become your biggest branding factor.

Speed Up and Be Counted

Research has shown that an average Internet user spends no more than 8 seconds on a webpage. They hardly read the content on the first visit and rather scan through it. And with multiple sites open in different tabs you don’t have the luxury of time with your design. Responsive web design renders compatible version of images and graphics onto the browser, thus speeding up the rendering process. So when you are up against competition on multiple tabs you will be counted among the best.

It is Cost Effective and Future Ready

Imagine the overhead cost of developing multiple versions of the same website and the amount of server space you would require. Add to it the trouble of creating a new version of the website each time a new device is launched in the market. This might require a team of designers to constantly keep working on the website to keep it in sync with the changing trends in the market. With responsive web design you can sleep in peace as your website will not only meet your present day needs but also will be ready for the future.

Mistakes Companies Make With Their Intranet

Nowadays Intranets are recognized as important business tools but there are many out there making some common mistakes. A successful Intranet needs a lot of work and careful thought to make your staff collaborate and share information but mistakes can limit its success, so it's better to test your Intranet design for mistakes before getting too late!

Here are some words of wisdom for you to keep you away from traveling that road of mistakes:

Complex To Use
Intranet should be intuitive, not complex. Otherwise, it becomes difficult to use as there is nothing worse than clicking here and there for retrieving the information. And users won't mind clicking if they know that they are searching in the right direction, but if they are not confident then more clicks can blow their minds.

Cloudy Navigation
A poor navigation system can confuse users. Navigation link should take users to the next level only, not into an entire different section. There must be a breadcrumb trail so that user can easily navigate without any disorientation.

Uncategorized Information
Un-categorization keep users away from the information. So to avoid this problem group the similar things together and make sure the words used in the categorization make sense to users and are descriptive of the information found within that category. Better to avoid bulky categorizations and keep most common categories on the top.

Universal Homepage
Some contents are relevant for most of the users, but not for all as each department in an office needs specific information only. Employees of different departments require different information, displaying all the information on the welcome page just doesn't work as everyone is interested in What's For Me not in What's For Everybody.

Cluttered Welcome-Pages
Welcome-Pages should be as simple as they can be so that users can easily find things they seek. It should not contain all the possible links; to keep your welcome-pages effective keep only those links which are important.

Creating A Single-Way Communication Platform
Design Intranet for employees not for the corporate. So to make your employees get involved ask them for their suggestions that what features they need to get their job done better.
Avoid to make complex approval process for publishing over the Intranet by employees as strict control stops users from participation.

Many Sign-Ups
Signing up every time to take a step ahead hesitate your users to go further. So better to keep a single sign-up step open the other doors automatically for them. As already too many passwords are there for users to learn, so it's better to give them a stress-free experience.

Ignore Security Issues
Everyone has some official data that can't be shared with everyone out there, so it's must to have some kind of security lock where employees can keep their official data secure such as financial data, strategies, organizational plans etc.

No Integration
Integrate your corporate Intranet with external sources such as News, Stock Price, Press Release so that users can interact with the outer world and can experience a better interface. Integration also increases the interest of users in Intranet.

No Search Option
Keep a search tool for the convince of users so that they are not supposed to go through each file and document while searching for something particular. An easy-to-search tool save efforts and time of your users and make your system more user-friendly.

We hope we made it – the wrongs you might end up in while developing your Intranet.

Thus if your aim is to connect with the people (and that remains the core aim in most cases), you need to know the tricks of effective web designing that will help your business grow online.

Effective Web Designing Approaches

* Structure The Site Smartly : Users do not like to think when they are browsing any site and thus when they are visiting your website, do not make them think. Typically a user will glance through the home page, scan through a few lines of text and if in those seconds they find something interesting will they proceed. Thus it is important that you have a solid layout using appropriate grids and layouts. The site design and usability needs to be intuitive so that unconsciously the user clicks on what you want them to click on.

* Focus On Important Elements : Before you start designing the website, you should already know who your target audience is and what is the purpose for creating the site. Answers to these will give you the focus that will make your site crisp and effective. Effectively synchronize text and images (remember that images are always more attractive and thus should be used wisely).

* Do Not Test The User’s Patience : As already stated, a user doesn’t have time or patience to scroll through unnecessary content to finally reach to what they want. If you need your user to sign up or register, make the process short. They are not signing into something extremely confidential that they need to fill in every personal detail.

* Crisp Content : Only have crisp content in your website. Having a 1000+-word paragraph of something unnecessary is a big NO. Keep your sentences short, stick to the rules of basic grammar and do not get too informal. No matter how trendy the user is, they still like to see things in a conventional way (mostly). Do not go on and on but break the content into sub-heads and paragraphs.

* Color Coordinate The Layout : Choosing the right color scheme that sends across the right message is crucial for a good web design. A website run by a doctors’ association cannot play around with loud colors while a music website cannot look dull. Only the right color combination will convey the right message.

* Keep it Simple : The golden rule for designers is to always keep things simple. Do not overdo either with the colors or with the layout. You cannot have everything on the home page nor can you have too less. Striking the right balance will appeal the users. The sites should have minimal ads, more content with images and multimedia and should be interactive and that is it.

We hope that these tips help you build better websites.

Tools to be Used in Wordpress Blog to make it more Fast

Undoubtedly WordPress is considered as one of the best content management systems in the market. With the help of WordPress web development you can design any kind of website without much difficulty. However there is one thing that often pulls down the greatness of the CMS and that is its loading time of the website on a server. WordPress is known for becoming slow as your blog becomes heavy with content. By using more plugins you further run the risk of slowing the site. What is the solution to counter this? In the list given below we have listed a few plugins that can help in making your WordPress blog run faster.

W3-Total Cache: To cater to a heavy traffic flow into the site, this plugin is a must have. W3-Total Cache lets you create static cached files thus reducing the time taken to load PHP and other scripts file every time the blog site is accessed. What makes W3-Total Cache one of the best tools to make a blog faster is that apart from caching files it also lets you use CDN created media files. With the help of this tool you can also remove unnecessary white spaces. Having these white spaces means that a server takes more time to load.

Plugins from Google Libraries: With the help of Google’s AJAX Libraries API, you can easily access many of the JavaScript libraries that are distributed with WordPress. When you access the libraries via Google, you do not need to serve them from your own WordPress directory. Using the Google libraries has several benefits. Most importantly it takes away the load from your server, secondly the chances of finding cached files in users’ computers increase and thirdly you can also access the compressed versions of certain libraries.

WP-DBManager: The best way to make a site fast is to keep the database uncluttered. The WP-DBManager offers such a plugin which allows you to find simple solutions to fix databases, optimize them and empty unused tables from the blog. By keeping your database updated you also reduce the risk of scripting errors. One of the added advantages of this plugin is that it lets you schedule database backups.

CDN Tools: Taking the help of a content distribution network, you can improve the loading speed of your blog. You can use CDN tools by allowing parts of your blog to be loaded from the closest server possible to each user. To use this plugin, you have to select the CDN service you want to use from a given Primary CDN field and enter your username and API secret key.

WP-Optimize: This plugin works great for optimizing the WordPress setup and clearing out unnecessary stuffs from the database. With the help of this plugin, you can enhance WordPress cms development. The program allows you to clear out old posts, auto drafts, and spammed comments. The plugin can also clear unapproved comments and all this happens with a single click of the mouse. By clearing the database, you increase the efficiency of the blog.
